Representation¶

Game¶

class gamegine.representation.game.Game(name: str = 'FRC Game')[source]¶

A class representing an FRC Game. Serves as the base container for all other representation objects such as obstacles, interactables, and zones. Also stores any and all game logic and state variables.

Parameters:

name (str, optional) – The name of the game. Defaults to “FRC Game”.

add_obstacle(obstacle: Obstacle) → Game[source]¶

Adds an obstacle to the game.

Parameters:

obstacle (Obstacle) – The obstacle to add.

add_obstacles(obstacles: List[Obstacle]) → Game[source]¶

Adds a list of obstacles to the game.

Parameters:

obstacles (List[Obstacle]) – The obstacles to add.

Returns:

The game object with the added obstacles.

Return type:

Game

enable_field_border_obstacles() → Game[source]¶

Enables the field border obstacles.

full_field_x()[source]¶

Returns the size of the field along the x-axis.

Returns:

The size of the field along the x-axis.

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

full_field_y() → SpatialMeasurement[source]¶

Returns the size of the field along the y-axis.

Returns:

The size of the field along the y-axis.

Return type:

:class:`SpatialMeasurement

get_field_size() → Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement][source]¶

Returns the field size of the game.

Returns:

The field size of the game.

Return type:

Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]

get_obstacle(name: str) → Obstacle[source]¶

Returns the obstacle with the given name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the obstacle.

Returns:

The obstacle with the given name.

Return type:

Obstacle

get_obstacles() → List[Obstacle][source]¶

Returns all obstacles in the game.

Returns:

All obstacles in the game.

Return type:

List[Obstacle]

Returns the half of the field size of the game.

Returns:

The half of the field size of the game.

Return type:

Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]

half_field_x() → SpatialMeasurement[source]¶

Returns the half of the field size of the game along the x-axis.

Returns:

The half of the field size of the game along the x-axis.

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

half_field_y()[source]¶

Returns the half of the field size of the game along the y-axis.

Returns:

The half of the field size of the game along the y-axis.

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

modify_obstacle(obstacle: Obstacle) → Game[source]¶

Replaces an existing obstacle with a new one, allowing for modifications to the obstacle. If the obstacle does not exist, it will be added.

Parameters:

obstacle (Obstacle) – The obstacle to modify.

Returns:

The game object with the modified obstacle.

Return type:

Game

modify_obstacles(obstacles: List[Obstacle]) → Game[source]¶

Replaces existing obstacles with new ones, allowing for modifications to the obstacles. If an obstacle does not exist, it will be added.

Parameters:

obstacles (List[Obstacle]) – The obstacles to modify.

Returns:

The game object with the modified obstacles.

Return type:

Game

set_field_size(width: SpatialMeasurement, height: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶

Sets the field size of the game.

Parameters:

  • width (SpatialMeasurement) – The width of the field.

  • height (SpatialMeasurement) – The height of the field.

Bounds¶

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Boundary[source]¶

Abstract base class for representing a boundary of an object. Boundaries are used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Boundaries can be translated, scaled, and reflected across the x and y axes. Boundaries can also be discretized into a series of points.

abstract discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

abstract reflect_x(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → Boundary[source]¶

Reflects the boundary across the x-axis at the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the boundary across.

Returns:

The reflected boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

abstract reflect_y(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → Boundary[source]¶

Reflects the boundary across the y-axis at the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the boundary across.

Returns:

The reflected boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

abstract scale(factor: SpatialMeasurement) → Boundary[source]¶

Scales the boundary by the given factor.

Parameters:

factor (SpatialMeasurement) – The factor to scale the boundary by.

Returns:

The scaled boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

abstract translate(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement) → Boundary[source]¶

Translates the boundary by the given x and y values.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value to translate the boundary by.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value to translate the boundary by.

Returns:

The translated boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Boundary3D[source]¶

Base class for representing boundaries in 3D space, extending the Boundary class. Boundaries in 3D space can be used to represent the shape of an object in 3D space. Can be used in all the manner of the base class, but also provides methods for getting the z interval of the boundary and for getting a slice of the 3D Shape at a certain z value.

abstract discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary3D[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

get_3d(z_start: SpatialMeasurement, z_end: SpatialMeasurement) → Boundary3D[source]¶

Returns the 3D version of the boundary. Simply returns self for already 3D boundaries.

Parameters:

  • z_start (SpatialMeasurement) – The starting z value of the boundary.

  • z_end (SpatialMeasurement) – The ending z value of the boundary.

Returns:

The 3D version of the boundary.

Return type:

Boundary3D

abstract get_slice() → Boundary[source]¶

Returns a slice of the boundary at a certain z value.

Parameters:

z (SpatialMeasurement) – The z value of the slice.

Returns:

The 2-dimensional slice of the boundary at the given z value.

Return type:

Boundary

class gamegine.representation.bounds.BoundedObject(bounds: Boundary)[source]¶

Base class for representing game objects which occupy a space on the field. Contain a boundary which indicates the space the object occupies.

discretize_ip(curve_segments: int = 5) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Discretizes the object in place, not returning a new object.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the object.

Returns:

This object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Returns a new object which contains a discretized version of its boundary.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the object.

Returns:

The discretized object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

mirrored_over_horizontal(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Returns a new object which is a mirror of the object over the horizontal axis at the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the object over.

Returns:

The mirrored object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

mirrored_over_horizontal_ip(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → None[source]¶

Mirrors the object over the horizontal axis at the given axis in place, not returning a new object.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the object over.

mirrored_over_vertical(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Returns a new object which is a mirror of the object over the vertical axis at the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the object over.

Returns:

The mirrored object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

mirrored_over_vertical_ip(axis: SpatialMeasurement) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Mirrors the object over the vertical axis at the given axis in place, not returning a new object.

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the object over.

Returns:

This object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

scaled(factor: SpatialMeasurement) → BoundedObject[source]¶

Returns a new object which is a scaled version of the object by the given factor.

Parameters:

factor (SpatialMeasurement) – The factor to scale the object by.

Returns:

The scaled object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

Parameters:

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value to translate the object by.

This object.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value to translate the object by.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value to translate the object by.

Returns:

The translated object.

Return type:

BoundedObject

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Circle(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, radius: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶

Class for representing a circle boundary, extending the Boundary class. Circles can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the center of the circle.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the center of the circle.

  • radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the circle.

discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the boundary across.

Returns:

The reflected boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

Parameters:

axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to reflect the boundary across.

Returns:

The reflected boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

Parameters:

factor (SpatialMeasurement) – The factor to scale the boundary by.

Returns:

Return type:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value to translate the boundary by.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value to translate the boundary by.

Returns:

The translated boundary.

Return type:

Boundary

gamegine.representation.bounds.CircularPattern(objects: List[BoundedObject], center: Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement], angle: AngularMeasurement, num_objects: int, prefix_func: Callable[[int], str]) → List[BoundedObject][source]¶

Creates a circular pattern of objects around a center point, allowing for a BoundedObject to be rotated and copied around a center point.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a circular pattern of.

  • center (Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]) – The center point of the circular pattern.

  • angle (AngularMeasurement) – The angle to rotate each object by.

  • num_objects (int) – The number of objects to create in the circular pattern, inclusive of the original objects.

  • prefix_func (Callable[[int], str]) – The function to prefix the name of each object with.

Returns:

The objects in the circular pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Cylinder(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, radius: SpatialMeasurement, z_start: SpatialMeasurement, z_end: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶

Class for representing the 3D-version of a circle, also known as a cylinder, extending the Circle and DiscreteBoundary3D classes.

get_slice(z: SpatialMeasurement) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Returns a slice of the boundary at a certain z value.

Parameters:

z (SpatialMeasurement) – The z value of the slice.

Returns:

The 2-dimensional slice of the boundary at the given z value.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

get_z_interval() → Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement][source]¶

Returns the z interval of the boundary, indicating the range of z values the boundary occupies.

Returns:

The z interval of the boundary.

Return type:

Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]

class gamegine.representation.bounds.DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Base class for representing discrete boundaries which can be marked by a series of points, extending the Boundary class. Discrete boundaries can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Can be used in all the manner of the base class, but also provides methods for checking if the boundary intersects a line, rectangle, or point, and for getting the bounded rectangle of the boundary.

buffered(distance: SpatialMeasurement) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Returns a buffered version of the boundary, providing a certain amount of padding around the boundary. Used to indicate safe areas which account for object sizes.

Parameters:

distance (SpatialMeasurement) – The distance to buffer the boundary by.

Returns:

The buffered boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

contains_point(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement) → bool[source]¶

Checks if the boundary contains a point.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the point.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the point.

Returns:

True if the boundary contains the point, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

draw(render_scale: SpatialMeasurement) → None[source]¶

Draws the boundary, used by the Renderer to draw the boundary.

Parameters:

render_scale (SpatialMeasurement) – The scale to render the boundary at.

get_3d(z_start: SpatialMeasurement = 0, z_end: SpatialMeasurement = 0) → DiscreteBoundary3D[source]¶

Returns the 3D version of the boundary.

Parameters:

  • z_start (SpatialMeasurement) – The starting z value of the boundary.

  • z_end (SpatialMeasurement) – The ending z value of the boundary.

Returns:

The 3D version of the boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary3D

get_bounded_rectangle() → Rectangle[source]¶

Returns the bounded rectangle of the boundary.

Returns:

The bounded rectangle of the boundary.

Return type:

Rectangle

abstract get_vertices() → List[Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]][source]¶

Returns the vertices of the boundary.

Returns:

The vertices of the boundary.

Return type:

List[Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]]

intersects_line(x1: SpatialMeasurement, y1: SpatialMeasurement, x2: SpatialMeasurement, y2: SpatialMeasurement) → bool[source]¶

Checks if the boundary intersects a line.

Parameters:

  • x1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the first point of the line.

  • y1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the first point of the line.

  • x2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the second point of the line.

  • y2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the second point of the line.

Returns:

True if the boundary intersects the line, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

intersects_rectangle(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, max_x: SpatialMeasurement, max_y: SpatialMeasurement) → bool[source]¶

Checks if the boundary intersects a rectangle.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • max_x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the top right corner of the rectangle.

  • max_y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the top right corner of the rectangle.

Returns:

True if the boundary intersects the rectangle, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class gamegine.representation.bounds.DiscreteBoundary3D[source]¶

Base class for representing discrete boundaries in 3D space, extending the DiscreteBoundary class. Discrete 3D boundaries can be used to represent the shape of an object in 3D space. Can be used in all the manner of the base class, but also provides methods for getting the z interval of the boundary and for getting a slice of the 3D Shape at a certain z value.

discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary3D[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points. Simply returns self for already discretized 3D boundaries.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary3D

get_3d(z_start: SpatialMeasurement = 0, z_end: SpatialMeasurement = 0) → DiscreteBoundary3D[source]¶

Returns the 3D version of the boundary. Simply returns self for already 3D boundaries.

Parameters:

  • z_start (SpatialMeasurement) – The starting z value of the boundary.

  • z_end (SpatialMeasurement) – The ending z value of the boundary.

Returns:

The 3D version of the boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary3D

get_slice(z: SpatialMeasurement) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Returns a slice of the boundary at a certain z value.

Parameters:

z (SpatialMeasurement) – The z value of the slice.

Returns:

The 2-dimensional slice of the boundary at the given z value.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

abstract get_z_interval() → Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement][source]¶

Returns the z interval of the boundary, indicating the range of z values the boundary occupies.

Returns:

The z interval of the boundary.

Return type:

Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]

gamegine.representation.bounds.ExpandedBounds(bounds: ~typing.List[~gamegine.representation.bounds.Boundary], robot_radius: ~gamegine.utils.NCIM.Dimensions.spatial.SpatialMeasurement = 21.0 in, discretization_quality=4) → List[DiscreteBoundary][source]¶

Returns the expanded bounds of a list of boundaries, providing a certain amount of padding around the boundaries to account for object sizes.

Parameters:

  • bounds (List[Boundary]) – The boundaries to get the expanded bounds of.

  • robot_radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the robot to expand the bounds by.

  • discretization_quality (int) – The quality of discretization to use when expanding the bounds.

Returns:

The expanded bounds of the boundaries.

Return type:

List[:class:`DiscreteBoundary

gamegine.representation.bounds.ExpandedObjectBounds(objects: ~typing.List[~gamegine.representation.bounds.BoundedObject], robot_radius: ~gamegine.utils.NCIM.Dimensions.spatial.SpatialMeasurement = 21.0 in, discretization_quality=4) → List[DiscreteBoundary][source]¶

Returns the expanded bounds of a list of objects, providing a certain amount of padding around the objects to account for object sizes.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to get the expanded bounds of.

  • robot_radius (SpatialMeasurement) – The radius of the robot to expand the bounds by.

  • discretization_quality (int) – The quality of discretization to use when expanding the bounds.

Returns:

The expanded bounds of the objects.

Return type:

List[:class:`DiscreteBoundary

gamegine.representation.bounds.LineIntersectsAnyBound(bounds: List[DiscreteBoundary], x1: SpatialMeasurement, y1: SpatialMeasurement, x2: SpatialMeasurement, y2: SpatialMeasurement) → bool[source]¶

Checks if a line intersects any of the given boundaries.

Parameters:

  • bounds (List[DiscreteBoundary]) – The boundaries to check for intersection.

  • x1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the first point of the line.

  • y1 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the first point of the line.

  • x2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the second point of the line.

  • y2 (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the second point of the line.

Returns:

True if the line intersects any of the boundaries, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Point(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, z: SpatialMeasurement = 0)[source]¶

class gamegine.representation.bounds.PolygonalPrism(points: List[Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]], z_start: SpatialMeasurement, z_end: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶

Class for representing the 3D-version of a polygon, also known as a polygonal prism, extending the Polygon and DiscreteBoundary3D classes.

get_slice(z: SpatialMeasurement) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Returns a slice of the boundary at a certain z value.

Parameters:

z (SpatialMeasurement) – The z value of the slice.

Returns:

The 2-dimensional slice of the boundary at the given z value.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

Returns the z interval of the boundary, indicating the range of z values the boundary occupies.

Returns:

The z interval of the boundary.

Return type:

Tuple[SpatialMeasurement, SpatialMeasurement]

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Rectangle(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, width: SpatialMeasurement, height: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶

Class for representing a rectangle boundary, extending the DiscreteBoundary class. Rectangles can be used to represent the shape of an object in 2D space. Includes additional methods for getting the minimum and maximum x and y values of the rectangle.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y value of the bottom left corner of the rectangle.

  • width (SpatialMeasurement) – The width of the rectangle.

  • height (SpatialMeasurement) – The height of the rectangle.

discretized(curve_segments: int = 5) → DiscreteBoundary[source]¶

Discretizes the boundary into a series of points.

Parameters:

curve_segments (int) – The number of curve segments to use when discretizing the boundary.

Returns:

The discretized boundary.

Return type:

DiscreteBoundary

get_max_x() → SpatialMeasurement[source]¶

Returns the maximum x value of the rectangle, being the x value of the right side of the rectangle.

Returns:

The maximum x value of the rectangle.

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

get_max_y() → SpatialMeasurement[source]¶

Returns the maximum y value of the rectangle, being the y value of the bottom side of the rectangle.

Returns:

The maximum y value of the rectangle.

Return type:

Returns the minimum x value of the rectangle, being the x value of the left side of the rectangle.

Returns:

The minimum x value of the rectangle.

Return type:

SpatialMeasurement

class gamegine.representation.bounds.Square(x: SpatialMeasurement, y: SpatialMeasurement, side: SpatialMeasurement)[source]¶
gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalX(objects: List[BoundedObject], axis: SpatialMeasurement, prefix: str, prefix_og: str = '') → List[BoundedObject][source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across the x-axis at the given axis, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axis.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, x = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.

Return type:

List[BoundedObject]

gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalXY(objects: List[BoundedObject], axis_x: SpatialMeasurement, axis_y: SpatialMeasurement, prefix: str, prefix_og: str = '') → List[BoundedObject][source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across both the x and y axes at the given axes, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axes.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis_x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x-axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, x = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • axis_y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y-axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, y = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.

Return type:

List[:class:`BoundedObject

gamegine.representation.bounds.SymmetricalY(objects: List[BoundedObject], axis: SpatialMeasurement, prefix: str, prefix_og: str = '') → List[BoundedObject][source]¶

Creates a symmetrical pattern of objects across the y-axis at the given axis, copying the objects and mirroring them across the axis.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[BoundedObject]) – The objects to create a symmetrical pattern of.

  • axis (SpatialMeasurement) – The axis to create the symmetrical pattern across, y = axis will be the axis of symmetry.

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add to the name of each object.

  • prefix_og (str) – The prefix to add to the name of the original objects.

Returns:

The objects in the symmetrical pattern.
